This was truly a marvellous experience, this game is what started what we know today as the huge game development studio and creator of this entire gaming platform, Valve. Black Mesa is a huge, highly enjoyable labyrinth of paths to figure out, puzzles to solve and plentiful aliens and military to fight. The Xen world is a bizzarely stunning world that'll guarantee every second as enjoyment and jaw-dropping environments, as well as vastly fun gameplay. The final fight with the Nihilanth just has to be classed as one of the best boss fights in any game I've ever played. So much fun came out of blasting the inside of its head apart ;) and the end monologue with the G man is highly interesting and mysterious.... I do recommend this game, and don't forget about the sequels and mods ;).

Contrary to what a lot of people think, and contrary to the belief of most modern FPS games, Half-Life is more of a fast-paced puzzle game than a shooter, something more strategic than modern Valve games' message of "Kill them all and pay us money." I mean, all of Valve's games are fun, but not necessarily primarily strategy games, like this. The concept of having to work to get to the finish is an aspect of Half-Life that shines moreso than other story-mode games. Congratulations (20 years late).

I finally managed to finish the game.

Half Life is a game that is composed of "set pieces" that as you progress through the game become more, and more elaborate, as difficult, as spectacular, as insane.

The whole game is a Science Fiction adventure, and one incredibly memorable at that, the whole thing feels like a journey that you're clearly taking part in.

This illusion gets created by letting the player play through the eyes of the game's main protagonist Gordon Freeman, that though you never hear him speak, or react in any other way than the one you want him to, it still has managed to become a "gaming" icon.

This is because however unlikely certain situations may appear to be possible to overcome, enemies to defeat, or obstacles to surpass, the game always finds a way to make it seem pausible that you may succeed, and you have to if you want to finish the game, obviously.

Now the problem that I have with some of this sequences is that at first their design seems brilliant, and simple, but as you keep progressing through the game, this "set pieces" can become jarring, disorganized, and, or messy, and frustrating to complete.

It is not only the fact that you'll have to repeat certain sections over and over again, some that simply rely in pure "trial, and error".

but also, there are ones that are incredibly cryptic, and while they simply do require a bit of patience, and thinking on the players side, more often than not, even whilst comprehending what is it that you need to do, the controls, and systems, simply work against you.

At one point I was done with a massive firefight against a couple of soldiers and a tank, since the game is an "old-school first person shooter" I had to rely in getting health pickups, my health was all the way down to four, of a hundred...

Right when I got through a doorway that was supposed to allow me to continue, I immediately got killed by a turret that was placed to edge of the door I had just walked through, luckily I had a saved right before it happened.

But tell me?

How the f**k are you supposed to know that was going to happen unless it had happened to you at first?

There's no way to know about it, the only thing that could give you some input that the turret was there, is a sound that they produce when they're active, but in the midst of everything crumbling around you, the explosion of the tank, the gunfire, and the flow of adrenaline that that leaves you with, you probably won't be able to listen to that.

There are other cases, other examples, near the end of the game there's a section that requires you to shoot at an enemy enough times you scare it away from you so it can destroy a wall and form a path through which you can continue.

First time it happened tho, the enemy didn't react, I had to reload another save file in order to get through it.

And then the last couple of sections, they require some horrible form of platforming, that doesn't even feel like it was designed with the systems the game had presented at that point in mind, it feels much more as if it's one of those cases you have to do everything in your power, whether it is what the game requires you to do, or not, in other to complete those parts.

Other times the enemies simply fill in the screen, and you don't get enough ammo to take all of them at once, even if you have to, it gets frustrating after a while, it is annoying, and most of the times, you have to improvise.

Whether this was intended or not, that's besides the point, it is not enjoyable for me.

However...

This where mere moments near the end of the game that turn an otherwise incredible experience in a bit of a "slog", crazy part is that when finishing the game though, as frustrated as I was, not even from loosing, but just from playing it, I felt this incredible sense of accomplishment that surpassed any sort of high score, or challenge in any other game I have played recently, it became clear to me that this game's brillance comes from offering the player a journey in which you actually feel you're part of, in which you feel as the hero, that partake in every event leading to the imminent continuation of an incredible narrative, that didn't come in the form of a cutscene, or text.

But instead, in pure gameplay experience, everything in this game you get to experience it through the players eyes, it is an incredible masterpiece in videogame design because of it, and even if it hasn't aged that well in some aspects, it has in plenty of others, and it still manages to trascend, and offer, the same experience that made it timeless in the first place, it is in my opinion, a clear example of what videogames can offer when handling the medium, with the respect, and care, it deserves.
sin duda half life es uno de los juegos de la vieja escuela, se los recomiendo y para cuando hl3 valve <3

Great story. Gets pretty trippy toward the end which is awesome. The only thing that was mildly annoying were the damned military units that are way too strong. 10 bullets to the chest and still standing strong. They had annoying commando type voices too, which made it so satisfying when you actually demolish them later in the game. Gameplay is a combination of trying to survive and conserve ammo, health, and shield. There are instances where running away is more desireable. Some puzzles and acrobatic jumping from platform to platform is also involved. Very fun, very hard at times.

A few months ago, I left a review about how buggy this game was and quit about 3 chapters in.

A few weeks ago, I picked up the game again with the ambition to just finish the damn game.

Today, I defeated Nihilath. In its ugliness and frustration, Half Life made me appreciate todays game design, and in its freshness and courage rarely seen today it made me love 1998's game design.

Thank you, Valve.

Hace poco me ha pasado a la MASTER RACE y buscaba un juego que me dejara paladear los orígenes de dicha raza. Sin duda no me ha decepcionado y se lo recomiendo a todos los putos noobs del PC como yo o gente que ya lleva sus años: 
IM-PRES-CIN-DI-BLE. 
Los gráficos y los diálogos han envejecido algo mal al igual que las mecánicas; sin embargo, es es un juego que se disfruta, con una amplia duración y variedad de escenarios. Eso sí, al final creo que se pasaron de poner tanto enemigo aunque lo suplen muy bien poniendo vida y munición con frecuencia.
Juégalo ya, no hay excusas está cada dos por tres en rebajas y son 2-3€ muy worth.

Başlamadan önce, saatime bakmayın Steam dışında hayatımı geçirmişimdir.

Half-Life iki oyun moduna sahip;hikaye ve multiplayer CO-OP.
Hikaye modunda karakterimiz Gordon Freeman Black Mesa'da bir mühendis.Çalışmaları sonucu kazayla dünyaya çeşit çeşit yaratıklar geliyor.Zombi olan insanlar (lamarlarla zombi olan insanlar) ve suç örgütleriyle tek başına savaşan Gordon Freeman'in hikayesini oynuyoruz.Oyunda çeşit çeşit acayiplikler var GMAN gibi.Oraları oynayınca anlarsınız karakterinizde etki yaratacak bir oyun olduğunu unutmayın.

CO-OP modu:
Arkadaşlarınızla yerden bulduğunuz silahlarla kapışabileceğiniz bir deathmatch türüdür.Arkadaşınız yoksa da yüzlerce Türk sunucusu mevcut.En güzeli de her bilgisayarda bu oyunu 60FPS oynayabilmeniz.

Gelelim yumurtalı sucuğun faydalarına...
Half-Life'ın fiyatı 18TL'yi çok görebilirsiniz, şahsen Steam arkadaşlarımla kolayca oynayabilmek ve Valve'ın emeğinin karşılığını vermek için Kış İndirimi vesilesiyle 1.80TL'ye aldım.Oyunu kesinlikle almalısınız.

第一次修改评测：
我玩半条命这款游戏已经很久了，自从小时候接触到CS之后便知道半条命这款游戏。我不得不说，这款游戏陪了我很久，它的成功是没人能质疑的，它比半条命2更有味道，不仅仅是游戏本身能够让我反复游玩也不会厌恶，其次是以它为本体的超多超好玩的模组，其中也不缺少沙雕逗逼类型的模组，这些模组为半条命不断发光发热！
当然，它的成功终究是游戏本身！！！！
denebilecek tek şey EFSANE!

first time playing it when I was a kid, still one of the best game ever after all these years
(dunno why steam didn't record my playtime properly lol..)
98 yapımı muhteşem bir oyun!

12小时通关，深有体会。
半条命是1998年发行的游戏，但是它的完整程度却让人震惊。
原本以为一两个小时就能通关，而最终却达到了12小时。一开始以为是动作游戏，后来才知道是带有大量恐怖元素的游戏。【以及被无数次扑脸吓到尖叫】
个人感觉地面惊魂和XEN星比较难，很多次都想放弃，但是最后依然坚持打完了。游戏中经常迷路【路痴本性】，然后又想放弃，但是每次都找到了正确的路。半条命没有什么隐藏道路，这条路如果没有地方走就一定是死路，不必纠结于puzzle。以及庞大的背景世界观令人叹服，角色的性格也刻画得超级棒！军队ai虽然有点蠢，但是也被推死无数次……总之，通关后终于了解为什么半条命对fps界影响极大了，即使拿到今天，它的剧情也可以超越许多游戏，何况在1998年。
于是决定到底是先玩针锋相对x蓝色行动还是直接HL2啊……

It is impossible for this game to be 20 years and be much better than some games we see today lol

Armorlar Önemli Tabi

Perfect game from a simpler time.

One thing that annoyes me the most about modern games, yes I'm looking at you Metro, is the fact that you are basically only watching cutscene after cutscene and you're barely even allowed to do anything yourself. 
Everything that looks remotely like it could be fun happens in cutscenes.

In Half life everything story releated happens while you're playing, without ever being interrupted. Characters talk to you when you run past and if you don't wanna listen to what they have to say you can just run by without caring, it's up to you.

Also the game doesn't bother explaining everything to the point that even a 3 year old would understand it, the leveldesign is so well thought out that you'll never even end up asking yourself what to do. If you can't take the most obvious route (because of a locked door for example), all you have to do is look around and you'll find other paths to take, or at least clues of what you are looking for. That is much better than markers all over the map or an annoying AI running with you telling you the same hint over and over again.

One thing that bothered me a little bit would be how ridiculously inaccurate certain guns are, but overall the gunplay and movement feels very solid and obviously familiar for cs players.

It's a tiny download, you can grab it for under $2 during steam sales, it runs on every toaster and is an absolute pillar in the world of gaming, why are you even reading reviews?
